What I really love about the President-elect's plan: it's not just a plan to get vaccines out to people — which we absolutely need — it's also a down payment on building a more just and equitable economy. Taking on child poverty would be transformative for America.

The American Rescue Plan is the bold action that we need to crush this virus and rebuild the economy: a national vaccination plan, more economic relief and a critical investment in reducing child poverty. I'm ready to work with the new admin and my colleagues to get this done.

I am cosponsoring H.R. 46 "One Bill, One Subject Transparency Act" which will require every bill enacted by Congress be limited to only one topic that is reflected in the bill's title.
I am cosponsoring H.J. Res. 7 which will amend the Constitution so that if members of Congress do not pass a budget prior to the beginning of the fiscal year they do not get paid.
I am cosponsoring H.J. Res. 3 which will amend the Constitution to require a balanced budget.
I am cosponsoring H.J. Res. 12 which will amend the Constitution to establish term limits for members of Congress.

THREAD: The first four pieces of legislation I'm cosponsoring will help reform the federal government by increasing transparency and changing incentives.

Read more ⤵️ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErugIouXAAApMf1.jpg

Vamos! #SiSePuede #OutdoorsForAll #nmpol https://www.heinrich.senate.gov/press-releases/heinrich-welcomes-launch-of-national-outdoor-equity-initiative

I look forward to supporting this powerful national group of leaders to make our parks and public lands places everyone can enjoy and ensure we are supporting the next generation of stewards of our air, land, water and wildlife. 
 
📸: White Sands National Park, April 2019 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErtMeg7XcAETcmO.jpg

Outdoor F.U.T.U.R.E. builds on this to tackle the systemic inequities that prevent underserved youth and communities of color from engaging in meaningful, educational experiences on public lands. 

This new initiative will be a blueprint for legislation I plan to introduce soon.

The livelihoods of people of color have long been rooted in the outdoors, but they haven't always had equitable access to public lands. 
 
In New Mexico, outdoor equity advocates and community leaders have led the way in breaking down some of these barriers.

Everyone should be able to enjoy public lands, regardless of wealth, where you grow up, or the color of your skin. 
 
I'm so excited to begin work with Outdoor F.U.T.U.R.E., a new outdoor equity initiative created by Black, Indigenous, & leaders of color. https://outdoorfuture.org/

Our hope is that the availability of the index will inspire researchers to focus more on social capital and its relationship to other features of economic and social life. And we hope it will aid policymakers as they seek to address the country’s needs.

The Social Capital Index was created to rectify this problem. It presents the geographic distribution of family unity, family interaction, social support, community health, institutional health, collective efficacy, and philanthropic health. https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/republicans/analysis?ID=3EECE4D1-4B49-4DBA-9C3F-37A541769799

Social capital is an important factor driving many of our nation’s greatest successes and most serious challenges. However, until recently, policymakers and researchers have lacked high-quality contemporary measures of social capital.
Read more about seniors’ emotional and social health during the pandemic: https://www.jec.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/republicans/analysis?ID=740E1570-B551-4339-B4E2-C81F3CE7826C

More seniors are emailing or writing to their family and friends weekly in 2020 compared to 2016. Overall, in 2020 roughly the same number of seniors—slightly more, in fact—said they often had someone they could talk to compared to 2016. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErsvThXXcAMYHj9.jpg

Seniors’ engagement with social media and video conferencing apps has increased substantially over time. Far more seniors are using platforms such as Facebook or Skype to connect with family and friends in 2020 than were doing so four years ago. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErsvNJrXIAIA9w7.jpg

Comparing 2020 responses with the 2016 survey results shows that the percent of seniors experiencing stress, depression, or loneliness in the past week is nearly the same in both years. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErsvHGdW8AA9rr3.jpg

Only 6% said they have often felt emotionally overwhelmed since the pandemic began and only 9% said they have often felt stressed, although 35% said they have sometimes felt emotionally overwhelmed and 46% said they have sometimes felt stressed. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErsvAEeXcAI-0DD.jpg
